text: Draft at Moeder Lambic (fontainas), cuvée Moeder version. Pours red with a frothy head. Very sour with loads of cherries in the nose, not that sweet. Sweeter mouthfeel, acidic. Flavour is intensely sour, a lot of cherries, low-medium sweetness. Finishes with an intense cherry aftertaste.

Draft at Moeder Lambic fontainas. Pours deep red. Nose is cherry, raspberry, strawberry. Palate is intensely fruity, just a hint of sourness (this is basically all sweet and fruity compared to the framboise I had yesterday), cherry jam, berries. Im glad I came back to try this, probably my favourite Kriek Ive had. Very drinkable, very refreshing, very fruity, I cant get enough!

Tap at Moeder Lambic Fontanais. Beautiful ruby red, slightly hazy, with a big fluffy pink head. Majestic. Deep sweet cherries, sour cherries, cherry stones, almond. Dense fruitiness. Moderate sweet and crisp tart note. Light nutty, fruitstone bitter. Medium body, low carbonation. Very fruity, very nice.

Cask at Moeder Fontainas. Clear deep red with big fluffy bright pink head. Looks amazing! Lots of tart cherries, light hay and grass, soft funk, light dough and grains. Under medium sweet and sour. Under medium bodied with barely any carbonation. Not as god as the regular kriek but pretty good overall.
Cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Bruxelles. Pours red with pinkish head. Fantastic cherry, berry, sour combo. Funky. Leaving long aftertaste. Soft carbonation, medium bodied. Easy drinkable.

March 17 2017. On cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. 
Light hazy red with a moussy slightly off-white pinkish head. Aroma is fruity, nutty and light funky with juicy cherries, almond, a touch of wet leaves and yoghurt.
Taste is light sour, fruity, soft funky. Medium bodied, soft carbonation. Slightly dry finish with cherry sköna and a light astringency, some lemon juice, yoghurt, smoothing almond notes, soft funk.
Nice, möts of cherries, both sweet and juicy and tart skins, quite distinct almond note as well.

On tap at Moeder Lambic Fonrainas. Hazy bright red with a tall pink head with surprisingly good retention. Notes of cherries, bitter cherries, almonds, lambic funk, mild acidity. Lighter in body than the normal kriek and feeling a bit more fresh.

From notes. On draft at Moeder Lambic  Original on November 11. The pour is a bright ruby color with a huge light pink head and a couple soapy traces of lace. The aroma is surprisingly funky. There is a good fruit skin to it, but the tartness really isnt there. Its strong on the funk, per the usual for Cantillon. The flavor is fantastic. Its like tart cherry pie filling. There is a light funk, but the tart cherries are huge. The skin is nice, and there is a solid oak to it as well. The mouth feel is light and crisp with a bright carbonation with a lingeringly tart cherry with a bit of funk. I like this a lot!

Brilliant red with a very nice cherry nose. Assertive, but not so much as to put it out of balance. Better than the standard kriek...both fruitier and funkier, and a touch short of the Lou Pepe (an all-time favorite).
Draft - pours pink with pinkish white head - nose/taste of cherry pie, horsey cherry tinged hay and oaky funk - medium body

Tap @ Moeder Lambic. Pours hazy dark red with a small pink head. Aromas of sweet cherries, marzipan, classic Cantillon funk, sweet. Taste has sweet cherries, marzipan, funky, vinegary, jammy, cherry pits.

From tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Red ruby dark pour with a big pink head. Aroma has sweet, Dark cherries, vanilla, marzipan, cherry pits, light leather. Taste is sweetish and fruity up front, but gets sweeter with lots of cherry and spices. Rather dry finish. Very Nice balance!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap @ moeder lambic. Pours hazy red with a fluffy bright pink head. Aroma of vanilla, cherries, funk, marcipan and slight vinegar. Taste of sweet cherries, tart vinegar, gummibears, marzipan and oak.
Draft. Dark Ruby pour, no head. Cherry, sour cherry, tart, oak and mild sour aromas. Flavors are wild, tart cherry and funky.

12th August 2016GBBF Day 4. Bottle. Probably thanks to Ian! Light haze on this pink - red beer, thin pink head. Palate is light, semi dry and has modest fine carbonation. Nice cherry, modestly tart. Mild cherry skins. Light finish. SImple stuff but tasty.

Out of a jug at the brewery.  Fresh smooth sourish cherries. Very smooth with a low sourness and not too much funk. The cherries are not too intense, but smooth and fresh. Round and intense sourish cherry aftertaste. Nice and easy to drink fruity beer.
Moeder cask version. Absolutely lovely juicy kriek, probably the very definition of the style and heading towards perfection. Legendary!
Duft sødlig rød duft kirsebær sødme smag kirsebær sød kant af vanilje rød frugt frisk

Draught at Moeder Lambic Original. Pours hazy ruby with a large, fizzy pink head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is heavy cherries, light earthy malt and hops with light bandage phenols. Flavor is moderate cherries, lactic sourness, light earthy hops and bitterness with a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.
Big cherries and tart fruitiness up front with a red hazy appearance. Very drinkable and pleasant.

cask oak comes through. profound red body. too acid (far more then a normal lambic) and unbalanced in palate. Cherries obvious and pleasant; smell a little unpleasant. but worth trying if only because unique and extreme.

Sample at Brasserie Cantillon Brouwerij, march 16th 2015. Unclear red body, pink head. Funky cherry aroma, wood, soft cheese. Taste of tart berries, raw malt, barnyard, with grass and hay in finish. Peppery sour aftertaste. Quite different from the Cantillon Kriek.

Tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, 24th February 16. Pours a deep pink, red, fluffy pink, white head. Aroma is cherry and funk, barnyard. Flavour is full on cherry, slight bitter, not overly sour, well balanced, great fruit taste, funk, damp wood. Lovely and really refreshing
@ Moeder Lambic 15-10-30: Stora toner av körsbär, fin syrlighet - helt utan kolsyra. Helt underbar
Cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Pinkish with a pink head. Aroma and taste of cherries, funk, oak and cinnamon. Really refreshing and nicely drinkable. An elegant one.
Almond aroma with big cherry fragrance, this is funky and great. Stone pits, cherry, wood, oak, vanilla, citrus with horse blanket on top. Great beer, and extremely drinkable without the carbonation.
Cask @ Moeder Lambic, Brussels. Hazy red body with a medium pink head. Cherries, fruity, juicy, funk, tartness, light basement, light dusty. Very drinkable. Lovely.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2016 Cask moeder lambik. Pours red pinkish with a white head. Aroma of tart, lacto, sour cherrys light barn, citrus. Taste is quite sour, funk, light barn. Good balance. High drinkability.

Cask @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brüssels as Cantillon Kriek Cuvee Moeder Lambic, 19/09/15. Pours a hazy, dark bright red with a pink, large-bubbled head. Aroma is a lot of cherry, semi-sweet, light cinnamon. Taste is fairly sour, appleskin, cherry, light barnyard, light cinnamon.

At chez moeder with Barry, Keith, and albert. Pours red shade with a white/pink top. Aroma of cherry skin, cinnamon, and a touch of floral cherry perfume. Flavor is lost of the same with some oak, lemon, and more cherry. Medium body with light carbonation. Tasty meh, try dis.

From cask at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Pink red color with pinkish head. Fruity aroma, cherry, sweet and light tart, light funky. Sweet and tart fruity cherry tasty like aroma. Light oily body with soft carbonation.

Draught at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels, Belgium. Shady ruby, pink head. Clightly artificial cherry aroma, notes of cinnamon. Light to medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry, medium acidity.
On tap at Moeder. Poured deep pink red with white pink head. Aroma sweet crushed cherries. Min carb med bod. Tastes sweet and a little sour loads of cherry, rind, lemon.

After having this on hand-pump at Moeder Lambic, I have to break my silence. This is just the most perfect expression of fruit lambic that I have ever had. A ridiculous amount of cherry character in the best way possible. Yes, there is sweetness but it is in perfect balance with the acidity unlike some other beers with this much cherry character. I appreciate that this is a variable thing but I think I had it in its most perfect form. On this night, I just couldnt imagine another beverage in the world that I wanted to drink as much as this. I could have had a half-dozen more of these and sat in amazement if it werent already late when we arrived.

(On cask @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas, July 24 2015) Pours hazy deep reddish oink with a pale pink cask head and a hint of lace. Aroma quite heavy on the sour cherry flesh with some skin, lactic yogurt drink, moist basement, mossy sort of wood make the funk undertone. Palate is quite bitingly sour with sour cherry flesh and lemon juice. More and more richness from the flesh builds to the finish, cherry skin too, reasonably woody, very restrained musty funk. A slight leafiness to the otherwise dry woody finish with acidity. Creamy medium full palate. The expression of the complete cherry is so nice in the unblended form, far superior to the blended kriek but a little shy of LPP Kriek.
On tap at Moeder. Light read, pinky head. Cherries throughout. Krieks will never be my cup of tea, but this is admittedly a nice one.
just not a fan of this kind of thing. i like american sours and lambics, but this just doesnt do it for me.
On tap at Moeder. Garnet pour with a pink head. Sour cherry and funk bouquet. Loads of sour cherries with wet grass, lemon zest, and vinegar backbeats. Hints of oak. Good body and mouthfeel.
Draft pour. Pours a bright red with a pink head. The aroma has bright cherry skins and sour cherry. Really delicious cherry pie filling taste. Medium body and medium carbonation.
Draft - pour deep red with pink head. Nose is cherries, lemon zest. Taste is cherry juice with lemons and grassy notes.

Ruby red with rose foam. Fruity cherry sweet yet sour taste. No carbonation with an optimal sourness and excellent cherry use. A sour aftertaste, that is not intense, but quite lasting. Very nice beer.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2015 Draught @ Moeder Lambic. Fantastic reddish-pink color with big pinkish head. Subtle Kriek aroma, funk. Taste is nicely sour, not too sour, and fruit. So much fruit! Near-flat, as it is unblended. Fantastic!

Nyupptappad direkt från [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ bryggeri. Ljusröd vätska med lätt skumkrona. Tydliga körsbärsaromer med en lätt jordkällardoft. Smakar definitivt surkörsbär. Kärv och salivförintande munkänsla.

shared glass from draft at moeder lambik, poured a intense red colour with a pink head. strong sweet aroma of cherries, tart, caramel sweetness, same as with the framboise version from draft. its like it is a complete different beer. way to sweet, with allmost no carbonation. couldnt enjoy this as much as the bottle version!
Cask @ Moeder Lambic. Deep red pour with a generous head. Loads of cherries, almonds, vanilla, funk. May more fruity that the regular kriek.

Cask at Chez Moeder Saint-Gilles and poured into Cantillon lambic glass.

Ruby red color, pinkish/cream head, bubbles, thin foamy ring. Nose is cherries, tart, funk, oak. Flavor is cherries, oak, funk, Fruit Tarts. Light body, tart dry finish.

I started ordering this stuff in the large pints and consumed many of them. So good, I wish I could walk around the corner for pours of this stuff when I was in the mood. Alas, it will have to wait until my next trip to visit Brussels.

Cantillons lambic with sour cherries dissolved in it, tasted from tap at the brewery. This is what the famous Cantillon Kriek is made of. Feels like an old barnyard crammed with sour cherries and other fruit, hay, sherry, red berries, lemon, very complex. Obviously no head nor carbonation as with an unblended lambic (which is basically what it is, apart from the fruit). Dry, complex and totally refreshing on a hot day. Not commercially available but an essential must taste if you want to understand the complexity of Cantillons bottled fruit lambics.

Cask @ Moeder Lambic, St. Gilles. Pours red with a light pink head. Aroma is sourness, yeast, rich cherry, wood, cherry stones. Flavor is sour, rich tart cherries, almond, cherry stones, yeast, marcipan. Medium body, flat carbonation, lasting light sour finish. 300714

Tap. Clear red body with a small pink head. Aroma of sour cherries, brett, funk and caramel notes. Medium bodied, watery to oily texture and average carb. Sour aroma that ends up dry and tart. A great Kriek.

Verre de 25 cl, dun cask au Moeder Lambic St-Gilles. Arômes très intenses de cerises fraîches. Robe rouge et limpide, effervescence faible et belle mousse rose. En bouche, le lambic rappelant les agrumes réussit à percer au travers dune tonne de cerises fraîches. Finale plutôt lactique dintensité moyenne. Très bon, même si je crois que jai très légèrement préféré la version aux framboises.

Poured from bottle into sample glass (Kriek-off): Pours cloudy pink / red with a decent pink head. Aroma is funk and cherries. Taste is cranberry, tart, cherries... a bit medicinal. Medium body, decent carbonation.

On tap, 25cL. @Moeder St Gilles, Brussels. An unclear garnet-colored beer with a medium thin pink head. Medium persistence. After several minutes, a ring foam is still present. Aroma of wood, cherry, lactic acid, vinegar. First neutral, then powerful sour note that leaves on sour waves from medium to heavy. Very dry. Light body, thin texture, flat carbonation, long sour finish with a cherry aroma. Overall, this one made me think of the Jonge lambic : truely beautiful wild landscape, very sour and dry. A bit extreme for me. I prefer the tamed version !
Cask @ Moeder. tarter and with more acidity than the frambo but still as easy drinking. flavors of peppery cherries, dark cherry skins and wood

Cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels. Hazy red with a fluffy light pink head. Tart cherry fruit but not anything like the same level of oak and vinousness as the regular kriek. Drying finish. This really hits the spot and I prefer it slightly over the cask frambozenlambik.

Hand-pump at Moeder Lambic in 2012 while visiting with Joe. Fresh fruit on the nose, a tangy tart and dusty aroma becomes reality as you take the first sip. Bright and almost fluorescent glow from this in the tulip, minimal head retention and moderate lacing. Strong, young bright fruit taste with a dry barnyard finish. Interesting to try next to all the cask offerings at Moeder!
Cask on Moeder. a nice red-ish color. spicy cherries. with a rose pepper taste, lots of pure cherries in the glass, very nice indeed!

Cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Deep hazy red pour with frothy pink head. Aroma of tart cherries, quite fruity, a lot of Cantillon funk in this one, wet hay, light cheesy notes, quite lactic. Taste is very tart, fruity and lactic tartness (sour cherries and plain yoghurt), light grassy herbal notes as well. Palate is dry, light mineral carbonation. I like it a lot despite its relative harshness, the framboise is much easier drinking.
Dark red color, no head. Aroma cherry, sweet. Medium body. Taste bit woody, cherries, fruity, sourness but this is no too sour. Refreshing drinkable.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2014 Cask @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas (Bruxelles). Deep and hazy pinkish red with a medium fully lasting pink head and little lacing. Aroma... wow! A burst of cherries mainly, but also raspberries and some leafy notes. Lambic character is more present than in the Frambozenlabik. Theres some lactic notes too and fresh cherries again. Taste is also dominated by bright and fresh cherries along some raspberries, fruit sweetness, hints of barnyard and light/moderate tartness, some leafy notes and wood. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Slightly dry finish. Thats how you showcase the fruits in a lambic... so tasty and fruity. Very good!

At Antwaerps Bierhuyske. Thx Dylan.
APPEARANCE: light clouded deep red beer, no foam.
NOSE: kriek, sour, very nice in general.
TASTE: very very sour, but quite fresh and fruity still. Somewhat sweet even underneath all the sourness.
Very good!

pours red with a bit pink in it . small , big bubbled white  foam  
smell is cherrys alright ! More reminding to lou pepe kriek , than to cantillon kriek . wich is a vry good thing ! 
taste is dry cherrys . very pure . just like the raspberry lambic, theres not much sourness coming trough , but there is funk . dry back , Still the cherrys overpower the sourness and funkyness . very nice !

Tap at Akkurat, courtesy of bartender as a closing to our night. It pours a hazy ruby colour with a small pinkish head. Aroma is ripe cherries and little funky complexity. Very cherry forward. Taste is mildly acidic and still has some sweetness from the fruits. Again, pretty straight on cherries. Light in body with soft carbonation. Overall, would make for a fantastic happy hour drink but lacking the complexity of the kriek. Resembles the Intense Red for how straightforward the cherries are in this one.

On cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Pours a brilliant shade of cloudy red with about a fingers worth of frothy pink head. Good head retention as i drink my glass. Nose is explosive cherry goodness and that dominates the olfactory senses. Much along the lines of Lou Pepe Kriek, only it seems that they use other cherries in addition to scharbeekse. Taste is heavily fresh cherry as well, some light backing lactic tartness, but its mainly just from the cherry. Light mouthfeel, light tartness, light acidity, and a long finish. Fantastic beer! I still probably prefer LPK just slightly, but this is right there.
Tap at Moeder Lambic St Gilles. Beautiful color. Amazing cherry taste, with lime/lemon flavors, a bit of vinegar Found it very bitter and loved it.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 20.04.2013, tap @ Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas:
Frisk fruktig lukt med preg av malt, humle, bringebær, kirsebær, litt bærskal og gras. Frisk lett syrlig fruktig smak med preg av malt, humle, bærskal, friske bringebær, gras, kirsebær, syregras. Middels bitterhet som set litt. Veldig god.

Draft at Moeder Lambic, 09/30/2013. Earthy red pour, strawberry cream head, considerable retention. Aroma is fresh cherries, mild funk, yeasty, yet round, earthy vanilla with oak. Taste is dark sour cherry, juicy, not overly aggressive in tartness or acidity, lambic notes in the finish. Thin body, yet coats the tongue. Tasty.

On draught as Cantillon Cuvee for Zwanze Day at Avenue Pub! Pours a brilliant hazy reddish pink with white-pink ring of lacy head. Aroma is huge tart fruit, cherries and raspberries, with a hint of funky barn house yeast. Taste follows, tart, funky, awesome cherries. Dry and champagne like, but still very refreshing. Awesome!

Cask at Moeder Lambic

This one was amazing. Really impressive taste of cherries. Great beer from a great brewery
Clear Ruby with no head. Aroma of wild sour cherries, wheat, nuts. Taste of sour cherries, a touch of back sweetness, wonderful dry cherry finish

Tap at Moeder Lambic St. Gilles. Pours a rich cherry red color with big pink head. The nose is massive sweet cherry fruit, orange, and tart cherry dessert. On the palate, huge flavors of cherry fruit are balanced with some lemon/lime, and perhaps a little funk, but this beer is really just about the cherry. Not overly sweet, nice clean finish.
Tap @ Moeder Lambic, St. Gilles. Nice big head with excellent duration. Color is ruby. Aroma and taste are rich cherries, brett, little vinegar, malt and has a nice sour finish. Lovely.

Draught at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Hazy deep pink/purple liquid with medium pink head. Aroma of stone fruit, lemons, cherries, almonds, apples, barnyard and fruity funk. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of lemons, almonds and cherries. Medium bodied with low carbonation. Really nice.
Red colored beer with hardly any head. Sourish fruity nose. Bretts already noticeable too. Dry soursh fruity taste. Typical brett flavors. Nice dry sourish ending.
Draught at old Moeder Lambic. Outstanding the intensity of fruit. the colour. not too sour. stunning

As Cuvee Moeder Lambik. Red with a lasting pink head. Aroma of cherry and funk, with a faint hint of butter. Dry and very tart cherry flavour with a funky touch. Fresh sour cherries dominate the long aftertaste

On tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, pours a cloudy opaque dark pink with a big pink head. Aroma of potent cherries, moderate funk and a touch of sweetness. Flavour of potent juicy cherries, some barnyard funk coming through, and more juicy cherries. Super potent, with not really any sweetness. Beautiful palate, with a wonderfully potent cherry character. Even better than the regular Kriek.

Cask @ Moeder Lambic, St. Gilles.[as Cuvee Moeder]
Pours light muddy red with a small, staying, creamy, pink head. Aroma has sweetness, clear cherrues, light caramel and a hint of butter. Low carbonation, lovely dry and fairly light mouthfeel. Flavour has cherries, dryness, good tartness, light caramel. Lingering fresh dryness.

Draught @ Moeder Lambic St Gilles. The pours deep hazy red with a massive pink head. The nose is of sweet bakery bread, raspberry tart. Grape and mashed cherry. Honeyed fruit and fresh rain-swept field. Very inviting. The taste is pillowy sweet marshmallow spread. Delightfully vibrant sweet cherries. Only a hint of clean acidic tartness in the finish. Its just a pleasure to drink such a simple, delicious set of flavors. Soft, pillowy mouthfeel. Overall, absolutely great.

Tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. It pours deep red with a thick pink head. The nose is juicy cherry, light vinegar, musty, wood and earth. The taste is initially tart, fresh cherry, red grape skin, Granny Smith apple, some acidity, wood and light mouldiness, with a dry, tart finish. Medium body and soft carbonation. Juicy and fresh. A very drinkable beverage indeed.

On tap @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussel. Hazy dark pink body, medium light pink head. Nose is red berries, cherries, hints of straw and hay. Taste is mellow red fruits, raspberries and straw, with tart cherries and stable funk in the finish. High carbonation, light body. Very refreshing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Deep pink to light red. Pink head. Fruity aroma, mellow pungency. Taste is fruity and only slightly acidic. more mellow and drinkable.
4000, draft at moder lambic, amazingly beautiful red pour with pinkish head. Beautiful combination of cherry, tartness, acidity. Loved this beer on one of the best days Ive had on this earth

Enjoyed on tap at Moerder Lambic in Brussels, Belgium at the start of what was a pretty crazy night.  Appearance is a bright pink / ruby hue with a rich, bubbly head.  Aroma of light cheese, cherries, wild yeast, smells delicate.  Taste is good, at first the sourness is abundant but it settles down quite a bit.  Rather live carbonation, tastes somewhat like a lightly flattened cherry 7UP.  Pretty damn good stuff.

Hazed but bright red pour with a tall pink head. Fresh fruit/cherry aroma with a nice sweetness. Lactic tartness with nice lemon zest and green apple notes, some mild straw and grass, too. Overwhelming cherry flavor which gives a nice acidity as well as sweetness. Some lemon tartness, a bit of yeast, grass, yogurt, and must. A touch of sugar/candy, and a nice balance to it.

On cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. My first stop upon arrival in Belgium. This actually happened.

To say this beer is gorgeous is an understatement. A stunning ruby hue that sits underneath an everlasting pillow of lavender foam (picture forthcoming).

The smell is wonderful and inviting, with that distinguishable and inimitable cantillon scent. Lots of fresh cherries lead the way, with additional notes of yeast, tartness, funk.

The flavor takes it up a notch. Sweet and sour cherries. So fresh and delicious. Just teeming with cherries and cherry juice. Amazing.

The mouthfeel is one of the best I have ever experienced in a beer of any style. Creamy and silky smooth. Each sip lingers on the palate for several minutes. 

I only made it to this establishment once, but I stayed for several hours and was able to enjoy a few pours of this. Well worth the trip. Cantillon is my favorite brewery, and this beer was well worth the effort.
2012.10.06 - sample at brewery (brouwkwintessens Cantillon) - nice kickoff off the day
Aspecte molt bonic , gusta natural a la fruita, una kriek  real sense afegits.

(Draught at Chez Moeder Lambic Saint Gilles, 18 July 2012, as "Kriek Cuvée Moeder Lambic") Dark red colour with frothy, pink head. Fruity, acidic nose with notes of cherries, almonds and a touch of wild yeast. Fruity, tart taste with cherries, almonds, red fruit and a dry finish with a refreshing acidity. Very tasty and in excellent balance. Very nice.

super dry super funky winey and dry character. very old school and right on par for this brewery, this is all they do. I have been on a tour at this brewery. Its the oldest brewery in Belgium.  I like this old world style wild yeast type funky wine beer. Great stuff,mmm

Tap @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Hazy dark red with big and lasting pink head. Aroma is sweet, malty, heavy cherries and almond. Flavor is medium sweet and rather acidic. Dry and rather acidic finish. 170712

On draught at Moeder Lambic (Fontainas) 

Pours a beautiful reddish pink with a huge pink head. 

The aroma is lots of sour cherry and yogurt. There is some resemblance to the Italian sour cherry jam I have in the fridge at home. The beer smells mildly funky. 

The flavor is sour and yogurt. A tad briney with plenty of cherry flavor both in the fruity and sour way. 


Quite different from the bottled Kriek.

Aroma:krisebær Ud.:rød Skum:  E.smag: sød modrat sur lidt Krop: For.:vandede Brus:  
 28-5-11@ 20th Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation

3/VI/2012 - on cask (hand pump) @ Moeder Lambic, Italian Beer Festival (2012-583) Thanks to 77ships for generously sharing his half liter! ;-) 
Cloudy red to rust brown beer, big pink creamy head, pretty stable, non adhesive. Aroma: lots of yoghurt, cherry flavoured yoghurt drink, bit sweet, some candy. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: tart and sour start, cherries, raspberries, yoghurt, bitter, little metallic. Aftertaste: sour yoghurt, raspberries, cherries, little bitter, lemon juice.
300kg grams of cherries vs 200 and not blended, quite a stunning results, tons more cherries, not as sour as the regular kriek, supremely drinkable

Bright ruby pink in color.  Solid bubly pink head.  Interesting farmhouse aroma.  Dry, light sour cherry taste.

I miss Belgium :(

On tap at Moeder Lambic.  Pour is transparent ruby red with a dark pink head and tight bubbles the sit forever.  The nose is very singular, huge cherries and little else.  Light dusty notes try to hit you up front but are faded by huge ripe cherries.  The taste has a bit more, notes of oak and a faint dustiness.  These flavors are again overpowered by a huge ripe cherry and moderate sourness.  The body is light and pretty soft on the palate with a lively prickly carbnatoin throughout and a rather dry finish.  Very tasty and easy to drink but a touch singular.
Cherry red, go figure.  Little head which disappears quickly.  Pungent sweaty aroma and a sour/tart taste.

Draught @ Moeder Lambic pouring up opaque rosy deep red with tall impressive pink head. The aroma has sweet ripe cherry notes rolling around with an undercurrent of yeasty tartness and faint acidity. The taste starts with a rush of smooth tartness that quickly ratchets up into more tartness and growing puckering acidity and tart cherry and cherry skins heading into the finish. At the finish and into the after taste mild notes of sort of yeasty slightly moldy citrus funk linger on the palate.

@ Stone fest , Chez moeder lambic 
Head: thick, pink, creamy 
Colour: deep red 
Smell: cherry, lambic, almunds, strawberry, semi sour 
Taste: start is milky sour, bitter cherry/red fruit palate, 2nd is sour/bitter red fruits, almunds end is dry bitter

On cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas a few weeks ago during our trip to Belgium. Served in a Cantillon tulip. Reviewed from notes.

Pours a beautiful bright, bright red with an everlasting white pink head. Once that eventually fades, there is loads of lacing. The nose brings forward some restrained funk and loads of fresh, tart cherries. Really impressive. Good acidity coming throughout plus strong cherry flavor and a light tartness. Lactic acid throughout. Light-medium body with moderate carbonation. Super-smooth and uber-enjoyable.

Draught @ Moeder Lambic event in Brussels. Hazy, purple to red colour with a big  pink head. Smells cherry, vanilla, fresh, sour and dough. Tastes sour, fruity and cherries. Crispy, not that much carbo, long aftertaste, balanced sourness.
nice krick aroma,red, cloudy, light red foam,lightly sour, light body, lively, soft carbonation, nice kriek finish.

Kriek Cantillon "Cuvee Moeder Lambic". Dark red coloured and hazy. Has a pink head, fully lasting. Aroma of cherries, almond, fruit, sugars, acid. Flavor starts light sweet and finish moderate acidic and light sweet, harmonic, refreshing, acid. Dry texture and soft carbonation. Moderate astringent.

Draught at Moeder Lambic, Brussels, for Zwanze Day 2011 as well as the Moeder vs Stone beer festival. Sampled on September 17, 2011As "Kriek Cantillon Cuvée Moeders".Hazy rhubarb red color, lasting bubbly pink head. A manly beer indeed! Sweet, cherry pip, almond scent. A bit thin, sour, acidic, metallic, berry, cherry peel taste. Thin mouthfeel. No hop bitterness, but you get chery skin tartness.

Draught at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas (as Cantillon Kriek Cuvee Moeders Cask). Nice red color, decent sized pink head. Smell sweet and a hint of sour. Taste slightly sour and dry. Good balance, soft carbo, low to medium body.

Hand pump at Moeder Lambic, FontainasCloudy dark ruby color, with pink head. Mild aroma of cherry pits and cherry, and not sour. Smooth mouthfeel, with almost no carbonation; the Lambic character is soft here, with strong cherry presence (but no sweetness); the cherries give a lot of astringency too, and a nice, dry, fruity touch; mild sourness. Very good.
Cask at Chez Moeder Lambic Saint Gilles, Brussels. Named Cantillon Kriek Cuvee Moeder Lambic. Red with a small pink head. Viegar and cherry aroma. Taste sourish cherries. A nice kriek.

From cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Pinky red with a big frothy pink head made of small bubbles. Aroma is naturaly massive cherry with lambic sourness. Extremely fruity taste, beautiful and the sourness really hits the back of the tongue. Lovely lingering cherry aftertaste. Without a doubt, a classic!

Cask at Chez Moeder Lambic Saint Gilles, Brussels. Named Cantillon Kriek Cuvee Moeder Lambic. Red/purple beer with a white head. Sour cherry aroma, rubber and grapefruit. Lovely cherry flavor, you can really taste the real cherries, and still its sour and bitter. Rubber notes, sourish, fruity, some grapefruit, some wet grass. Wonderful beer!

My 4000th rating! Cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels. This milestone was a long time coming but its finally here, and for me, this beer is a perfect choice for it: Its my first time in Belgium, celebrating my 10 year wedding anniversary with my wife, at a great bar, drinking a beer from one of my favourite breweries and its made special for this place -- to me its a no-brainer. Right, here goes: Pours a gorgeous dark pinkish-red with a large lasting fluffy light-pink head. Lovely aroma of tart cherries, spices, yeast, some wood and a hint of sweetness. Flavour: Yum, so delicious! Lots of tart cherries along with some wood, lemon citrus, light spices and a nice tart finish. Medium bodied. A spectacular beer, the locals are incredibly lucky to be able to drink this on cask regularly -- it was an amazing treat.
Bottle at the Delerium Cafe in Brussels.  Light red/brown with short lived head after a vibrant burst when poured.  Smells very lambic.  Very sour.  Gets easier to drink after a couple of swigs.

Dark red-purple, small bubbled pink head. Cheesy soft cherry nose, medicinal and a bit spicy in cinnamon. Flavor is very sweet light rubber and dust leading at the front and followed by cherry at the mid, which becomes rindy in the finish. Low carbonation, lightly stinging bitterness. Overall its too sweet and uncarbonated, though a ton of the cherry flesh is captured in the flavor, particularly the mid-palate.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2011 Gravity @ 20th Weekend of Spontaneous Fermenation, Tapperij Beukenhof, Broekstraat 18, Buggenhout, Belgium.Unclear medium to dark red colour with virtually none head. Aroma is moderate cherry, butter, almond notes, fruity cherries. Flavour is moderate sweet and light acidic with a long duration. Body is medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is flat. [20110528]  7-4-7-3-15 
Draught @ Cruise Roma - Barcelona, Un Mare di Birra, Grimaldi Lines. [ As Cantillon Kriek Moeder ].Clear dark red colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly diminishing, pink head. Aroma is moderate to heavy cherry, sour cherry, tart cherry, almond, fruity cherries. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate acidic with a long duration. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is flat. [20110612]  8-5-9-4-17

tap at moeder lambic.    pours a ruby red with bright pinkish red highlights and a huge foamy light pink head.     aroma of sweet creamy cherries, fresh leather cowhide, and a touch of cinnamon (from the cherry pits, according to the bartender).   taste is watery, moderate lactic acid, earthy, grassy oak.  low carbonation.  moderately dry.  quite easy to drink.   great beer.  lots of fruit character.

Draught:
Vast pink head on top of a darker pink rose beer.
Smell yeast, cheese, red fruit, cherries and a hint of nuts.
Taste is a lovely mix of cheese, cherries, hint of other red fruit, yeast, something yoghurt a like, barnyard, light sweet, some wood and herbs.
Lovely sour fruity aftertaste.
Low carbo, full body, soft mouthfeel and a watery texture.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
Quite hazy cherry red colour, no carbonation, no head. Aroma pronounced fresh cherry with fruity cantillon lambic background. Some almond / cherry stone touches. Flavour is quite sweet fresh cherry, very pleasant fresh cherry. Well balanced tartness. Lingering cherry in the finish. Reminded me of early summers eating fresh krieken at my grandmothers place when I was young. Very nice, enjoyable spring beer.
(27 May 2011. Glass at the brewery. Very young kriekenlambik, with thanks to Dan Ashley and friends for sharing)

Säuerlicher marmeladenantrunk, der insgesamt wässrig wirkt. Durchaus ausgewogen und stimmig, zum Ende auch wieder aromatischer. Eine im Antrunk vorhandene hintergründige Süße verschwindet zum Ende wieder. /10/11/11//10

On draft at Moeder Lambic, Brussels.  Slightly hazy red pour with lasting pink head.  Aroma of spur cherries and almonds.  Expected sour cherry flavor but with an unexpected sweetness balancing it off.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2013 (05/08/2011) [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Moeder Lambic: crimson head with an extremely lasting pink head, smell is that of sour cherries, taste starts out with mainly acidic & some slightly sour cherries and is followed by a surprising almost like sweet but not quite yet there cherry flavour, very different from the normal version, much better than the regular one on tap but slightly below an aged bottle of the regular one, either way this is an amazing beer///// [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2011: less impressive than the Chez Moeder Lambic one, seems a lot yonger, flat, no head, bit one dimensional & acidic, still very good but not as mindblowing, rating is for the Chez Moeder one ////////////// Noting that the one @ Chez Moeder Lambic is a different beer, more kriek, I think 300 gram if I am not wrong, fruitier + faint cinnamon note. Really, really good stuff. Both are great, prefer the Moeder one. /////////////////// Have had it many, many times on draft since original notes. Many times at Moeder & several times @ brewery. 4.8 -> 4.9 for this one, rating the Moeder version.

Cask @ Chez Moeder Lambic Brussels. Sold as Cantillon Kriek Cuvée Moeder Lambic. 300 grammes of cherries per litre, says the proud and knowledgeable landlord. Cherry and marzipan in the aroma. Sweet cherry flavor, sourish with cherry pits and almonds. marzipan. Oak. Good complexity. Long aftertaste. Luscious and delicious.

Clear ruby red coloured body with a thick, one centimetre tall pink head - absolutely perfect looking. Pungent sour aroma with a bit of sweet notes. Light-bodied; Very very mild sour tastes with some cherry flavours, a lot of sour notes and a bit of bubbles and a nice mild sweetness. Aftertaste shows some of the sour lambic qualities and a good mild kriek. Overall, a nice beer for sure, mild compared to the normal kriek, but a good finishing beer after a nice evening out. Definitely glad to sample this beer, especially a few kilometres from the source. I sampled this beer on draught as 25 cL from Chez Moeder Lambic Fontinas in Bruxelles, Belgium on 01-January-2011 for 4,00.

Draft @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas.
Couleur rougeâtre, col rosé.
Arôme, quen dire de cet arôme? Enivrant, on y note tous les aspects de la cerise utilisé dans son entièreté. Le tout laisse échapper cette aigreur des cerises, côté du lambic mélangé qui rajoute une fraicheur. 
En comparaison, jai trouvé le nez juste en dessous de celui de la Lou Pepe Kriek.
En bouche, on y retrouve un superbe lambic qui capture tout le goût de la cerise. Une aigreur se dégage et se mélange à cette macération et fermentation spontanée des cerises. Les noyaux donnent une touche dépice allant vers la cannelle pour un léger picotement en bouche.

From tap at Moeder Lambic as Cuvee Moeder Lambic. Pours hazy dark red with a huge, creamy and lasting pink head. Aroma is smooth and crisp cherry. Dry, inbetween acidic and sweet - smooth. Light sweet cherry fruity. Mild acidic and lingering fruity. Slight almondish. Crisp fruity finish.

Had on tap at Moeder. Comes a slight cloudy pinkish hue with minimal, if at all, head. Smell tart and cherry-ish. Tastes the same, wonderful. If they didnt have so many other beers to try I would have gotten this one all night. It is slightly more tart than the blended kriek, but is quite a bit better in my opinion.

La mia Kriek preferita, una delle mie Cantillon preferite. Complessissima, ma incredibilmente facile da bere. é gustosa, è dissetante, penso che possa essere uno dei migliori aperitivi possibili. Grandiosa.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Lambic Fontainas as Cuvee Moeder
Deep ruby color, pinky head. "Overriped" cherry aroma. Cherry, candy, fruityness in the flavor. Soft palate. Feels less tart than the normal version, but nice lingering tartness in the aftertaste. Cherry nectar!

[3324-20100809] Tap. Huge buckets of fresh sweet cherries in the aroma with mild barrel notes. Hazy, dark bright red body with a long-lasting foamy pink head. Tart cherry flavour up front followed by mellow tart yeast and wood notes with a sweet lingering yeast after. Medium body is cumulatively sour. Delicious, very nice.
(@ Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels, Belgium)
At Moeder Lambic as "Cuvee Moeder." Red with pink head. Nose very sour and ctirusy. Taste fruit, tangy and very bitter. Not very sweet but quite tasty. Enjoyed it.

Tap @Moeder Fontainas and @ The Dome. My God, this is the ultimate kriek experience!! Smells like tons of fresh cherries squeezed in some funky wood. The flavour is oustanding, very elegant for being a Cantillon (dont get this wrong), massive sweet and sour cherry blast.

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2010 [9/22/10] Draught at Moeder Lambic Fontainas in Brussels. As Cuvee Moeder. Very dark red with a big bubbly pink head. Sour cherries aroma with some barnyard, citric notes and hints of leather. Very sour flavor with cherries, lemon and oak. Silky mouthfeel.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2013 Cuvee Moeder Version at Moeder Lambic Fontainas.
A: Dark ruby red body. Large pinkish head consisting of millions of tightly packed bubbles. Slowly cascaded leaving behind film like lacing.
S: Massive cherry blast. Sweet, sour and tart. A little bit of musty oak.
T: Like the nose the cherries here are incredibly dynamic with sweet, sour and tart notes sharing the stage. Oak is here as well as a light musty funk. 
M: Velvety with medium carbonation. Refreshingly clean. Nice tantalizing sourness in the finish.
O: A very nice kriek which truly shows off all the cherries that were packed into this one. Unlike the lou pepe kriek which is quite juice like, this one has a little bit more of a zip to it that is quite nice.
Monks Cuvee Version (6 glasses consumed over a week at Monks... Im greedy.)
A: Deep blood red. The clarity varied between the glasses that I had. Earlier glasses had some clarity, but they became increasingly less transparent. Very thin pinkish skim. Quickly recedes, minimal lacing.
S: Dank sour cherries and a bit of funky oak. Nowhere near as complex as what was to come... 
T: Amazingly cherries, bold tartness, sharp acidity, and a nice little puckering. Also present is a dash of citric notes, funk, leather, and oak. Very assertive, but not overwhelming.
M: Low, but not non-existent carbonation. Velvety on the tongue. Medium-light bodied. Immensely refreshing. Wish I had a cask of it in my house to pour myself 4 oz before heading to work every morning.
O: The different Cantillon krieks serve different purposes.  The regular is mind melting sour, the lou pepe is bright and juicy, and this, like the Cuvee Moeder kriek, is packed with complexity.  Sad that this one might not be around for a while.

On tap at Moeder Lambic as Cuvée Moeder.
Appearance : Ruby red.

Aroma : Intense cherries with a slight notes of what felt like cinnamon. Quite sour, slight barnyard. Quite tannic.

Taste : Lots and lots of cherries. Nice sour finish with notes of oak. Loads of cherries and quite sour. Nice tartness on finish.

Overall : Wow this was very good. Intense fruits and very complex. The only thing I wasnt sure was the tannic profile but it was quite light and there was so much good stuff around.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2010 On tap at De Heeren van Liedekercke. Pours a deep burgundy color with almost no head and no body. The aroma is very sour wood and very unripe cherries. The flavor was very tart almost like a red wine; woody, lots of sour cherries, slightly dusty. Nice. Id address that this was very different that the beer I had listed as Moeder Lambic. The Moeder was all fresh cherries and sweet while this is all sourness and wood. Earlier Rating: 9/2/2010 Total Score: 4On cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Pours a bright red color with a huge mostly pink head. The aroma is tart cherries and yeast, some sweet notes as well. The flavor is very much a cherry sweet fruit lambic bursting with freshness and cask goodness. A fluffy mouthfeel. Some tart oak and yeast as well as the omnipresent funk. Very different than the bottled and aged version you get in the regular Kriek, much sweeter.

Handpump at Moeder Lambic. Beautiful, huge, fine, pink head on a glowing red beer. Cherry and yogurt nose. Soft bosy, sourness controlled, with yogurt. A bit dusty but not as much as in the bottle. Cherry flavor is not as huge either. Can taste the nutty stones. Greatsmooth, balanced, and very drinkable.

Draught @ Moeder Lambic, Brussels. Pours bloody red with a creamy pink white head. Nose is tart , fresh and really fruity. Lots of rather fresh cherries. Flat carbonation. Dry, refreshing fruity flavor. Vague almond. Feels like a pure nectar. Dry end..

Rating 600! On tap at the Moeder café in Brussels, same story, this is Cantillon Kriek with a slightly different recipe an only available on tap at their cafés. Aroma is a very smart mix of cherry flavour and lambic. The appearance is a nice deep burgundy red, just like wine, but then theres this fluffy pink head on top. The taste is an almost perfect mix of deep cherry flavours and lambic sourness, many different levels of both can be tasted sip after sip. In my opinion its a better recipe than the original Cantillon kriek, and this shines with its great balance between cherry and lambic flavours.

2010-08-09. Very dark red body, good sized frothy pink head. Aroma seems stronger than the regular kriek, soft rich cherries with a brief hint of feet, and sour cherry pie. 7+ Flavour is quite sour at first, before a stronger cherry flavour emerges. Less sour as it goes on, but still spikes and grabs at the cheeks occasionally. Hints at leather, but not really. Cherry skins. 7+ Smooth average plus palate feels more full bodied than its bottled cousin. Very good and very well made but the overall impression is not entirely to my own tastes. With extra cherries, On tap at CML Fontainas, Brussels

Handpump at Moeder Lambic. The fellow that coaxed this from the cask informed me that its a slightly different recipe than the bottled kriek, there being more cherries in this version.

And right he was. A three dimensional cherry flavor, tart and dry, fills the mouth. Its tempered with a miniscule amount of oak. Indescribable ecstasy.

They offer this by the glass or the "cruchon," a 1L serving vessel. A tantalizing prospect, but I think its intended for multiple people. Plus Zwanze beckoned..
user_location: The Court of the Crimson King, California, USA

text:
Sampled on draft at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas; July 2010
The pitcher poured from the tap has a big, large bubbled, pink tinged head of foam to it and the color is a hazy, deep red hue.  The aroma of this beer is fantastically creamy smelling in its cherry character (if that makes any sense at all); buttery cherry notes, some cherry pie like character and just a really over-the-top cherry aroma push this into cherry overload.  This smells so sweet and cherry-full; the bad thing is that the cherry just completely dominates the aroma here, the good thing is that the cherry is so rich and complex in and of itself that it really works.

The taste is shockingly dry given the uber-fruit expectations one got from the aroma.  The beer is light bodied, but has lots of cherry skin tannins that add texture and fullness to this beer (though it is also likely that the oak contributes to this texture).  The beer has a light spiciness to it, has a huge tartness and an aromatic cherry flavor.  The fruit definitely plays a big role in this beer, it is way bigger than any bottled version that I have had from Cantillon and I wonder if that is because the Kriek has to be watered down with Lambic to kick-start the bottle conditioning.

The cherry character is just so huge throughout, but still this manages to be so dry, which the 3 Fonteinen Schaerbeekse Kriek does not fully manage.  The aroma has such a cherry explosive character that it is quite awesome how bone dry the flavor of this beer ends up being.

Tasted with friends at WOSF 23.05.10. 
Dark red color, no head.
Aroma cherry, sweet.
Medium body.
Taste bit woody, cherries, fruity, sourness but this is no too sour.
Refreshing drinkable.
A good one from Cantillon.
Tap at WOSF10.  Sweet cherry syrup aroma with a hint of vinegar.  Cloudy dark red color with no head.  Light sweet cherry flavor initially followed by a tart, light vinegar finish.  Nicely blended.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2010 NOTE: This rating is for the special CUVÉE MODER LAMBIC version.  Exclusive to both Moder Lambic locations.  I later confirmed with Cantillon brewer that it is like their Kriekenlambik except that they use a lot more cherries for this version, almost twice as much.
In short: A superb cherry beer with a mild funky and acidic edge
How: Hand-pumped Moeder Lambic Saint-Gilles and at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels Belgium.
The look: Dark red body topped by a large long-lasting pink head
In long: Strong nose of fresh cherries with only a tiny bit of funk.  This smells a lot more like a cherry fruit beer than a lambic cherry.  Taste is simple but how effective!  Lots and lots of fresh cherries with a mild dry acidic bite in the finish.  A bit of funk.  Maybe some grapes in there too.  Unlike most fruit cantillons the lambic is not the main attraction here.  They use so much cherries for this special Cuvée Moeder Lambic version that the beer is more like a cherry beer than a lambic-cherry.  With the difference that the lambic does make the beer dryer and a little acidic.  Probably my favourite cherry beer ever.  I like it as much as a fresh Lou Pepe Kriek.  I had the regular Kriekenlambik at Cantillon.  It is good but I much this version.  If you are hoping for a lambic-cherry you might be a bit disappointed but if you look at it as a cherry beer it is simply mind blowing.  What an unexpected surprise.  They say nice things always happen to those who least expect it.  Seems to be true.  Ive been expecting to get  beaten up in a dark alley.  For so many reasons.

BottleHazy raspberry-colored ale with a mid-sized, fluffy, pinkish head. The aroma is funky, earthy and very acidic. Medium-bodied with moderate carbonation. Sour, funky, fruity flavor with mild hop and yeast bitterness. Very tart, semi-dry finish.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2010 On cask, Kriek Moeder Lambic.  Said to be 20% Schaerbeekse cherries blended with other cherries.  Pours a cloudy red with a pink head.  Amazing aroma of coconut, cherries, vanilla, almonds, other spices and a little tartness.  Flavor mimics, with almonds and coconut really pushing through the cherries.  Extreme complexity in sweetness, tartness and even mouthfeel.  Just a touch of sour, a touch of tart, a touch of sweetness and a touch of earthiness.  Smooth as can be, and super easy drinking.  This beer rocks.  The odd coconut flavors really make it special.   Reminds me of some kind of coconut, almond and cherry butter cookie.  Very fresh and possibly the most memorable beer Ive ever had.  I will remember this one for ages.  Fantastic.
Hazy deep red with a medium pinkish head. Fairly dry and sourish aroma with almonds and cherries. Dry flavour with sourish cherries, almonds, marzipan and peats. Finished sourish and dry.

Draugh as Kriek Moeder Lambic @ Moeder Lambic, Bruxelles. Red coloured. Unclear. Reddish white head. Aroma of cherries, almond and some earth and sourness. Good balance. Flavour is grapy, sweet, perfumed, full of cherries and almond. Medium to full bodied. Fruity and light grapy end. Very nice and easy to drink.

Draught at Moeder Lambic Saint-Gilles (as Kriek Cuvee Moeder). Deep reedish - oink head. High berries, cherry, stones, almonds, marzipan, fruity, light sourness, light soapy, lovely - high drinkability.

Draught at Chez Moeder Lambic, Fontainas.
Clear red coloured with a medium sized pink head.
Fruity and light acidic aroma of cherries, marzipan and cherry stones.
Light acidic flavour of cherries, marzipan and cherry stones.
Tart finish of cherries.
In The Rake. Great looking electric red in the glass. Fantastic balance of sour and dry peppery hops with just enough sweetness. Slightly woody, cherry pips, ripe fruit, funk and jazz. A rare treat!

A stunning Cantillon beer at the Rake! Great work by the Rake to give us TWO Cantillons in the space of a few months. Im pretty gobsmacked! I consumed this with Ang with the presance of Rich and Glyn.

Great company; fantastic beer. Dark red texture is stunning. So well balanced. Very long finish. Feel like my lambic palete has turned full circle. Great work in under a year. Id pair this wih a gateaux from the black forest or some dark chocolate. Thanks Tom for fantasitc conditioning.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2010 A Mes rate. Keg at the Rake.Candy apple red, slightly hazy and zero carbonation just as it should be. Young lambic wheaty funk with a barrage of sharp fruity goodness. This. Is. Fucking. Sublime. So good its almost comical. Each sip brings forth a huge shit eating grin that is beyond my control. Lashings of cinnamon and spice. Insane amounts of fresh fruity lunacy. So incredibly tarty, it should be x-rated. The mouthfeel is perfect. All the tartness sits around the edges and forms a tunnel of love for all the elegant sweet wonderfulness to fall into. Kinda like Emma Pierson in skimpy white La Perla undergarments, falling backwards onto a plush king size bed clad in crimson silk sheets. Its clearly a thing of unrivaled beauty. Ok thats my first half gone. Off to the bar for round two... Stunning fruit, just stunning. Very little acidity. More lactic than anything. The cherry notes are accompanied by strawberry, green apple, maybe even some apricot. Its a full set of Jolly Ranchers. The length is amazing but however much its hangs around, its never enough. Ive been hankering after this for a long time, and far from disappointing, it has exceeded my expectations. Utterly brilliant stuff. I think Im getting the horn...

Not much carbonation by the time I got this but I expected that so rating based on the fact that it was still quite good and enjoyable. An experience to me because it actually tasted different than a lot of other ones similar in style. Funky with cherry and a little wood. Some earthyness and more fruit with a little lingering odd flavor. Still good.

BCTC.  Many thanks to the incredible generosity of the RB crowd.  Red with ring.  Funky barnyard hay cherry aroma.  Funky cherry sweaty horseballs hay barnyard with dry finish.  Ok, I was drunk by this time, but my notes say I really liked this.
Metalic cabage yeast and dark fruit nose , pool water.  Tart and ripe lactic finish with a lingering juicyness.  Looks like grape juice with a disipating effervesence.

Draft @ Monks as Cantillon Monks Café Cuvee Kriek - consumed immediately after a bottle of RR Supplication (batch 2) at Monks.  This one was blood red (as best as I could tell at the back bar) with no head.  Aroma was bold with some really nice sour cherries, funk, and wet barrel.  Flavor is much more cherry dominant than any Cantillon Ive had - lots of wood, dark/tart cherry, and smoke.  Really good, but having the Supplication right before might have dampened my enthusiasm just a tad.
Draft at monks.  Pours a bloodlust body with a thin pink lacing.  Very dry tart cherries with very low acidity.  Tart cherries lightly woody with some earth and cherry pits.  Wow this is awesome!

Draft at Monks Cafe out of the beer engine.  Pour was a nice ruby with very little head and aromas of musty, tart cherries.  Flavor is more of the same, but has that strange Cantillon thinness in the mouthfeel.  I could drink this every day.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Cask, at Monks Cafe. Pours hazy maroon, capped with a medium-sized pink head that fades gradually to a ring of bubbles. Aroma is predominantly black cherry, with notes of wet leather, vanilla, and fairly mild acidity. Flavor is also fruit forward, with wood, vanilla, tannins, earth, and leather complimenting the sour cherry. Acidity is only moderate. Incredibly drinkable and very tasty.

Notes amalgamated from a few samples.  Deep cherry red colour with lots of haziness.  The aroma is intensely fruity with loads of soft cherry aroma, light woodiness and a soft vineous tannic note as well.  Kiss of almond/cherry pit on the nose as well.  There is a kiss of vanilla and a faint acetone character that accentuates, rather than dominates the fruit.  Soft funkiness on the back that picks up as you work your way through the glass.  Earthy, sour and intensely funky, but the sourness is quite muted, especially for Cantillon.  More lactic and soft than the typical citric Cantillon house character.  Musty/musky flavour toward the back finishing with a shot of acid.  This stuff is really complex and has a subtlety all its own.  Definitely worth seeking out if you find yourself in Philly.

Cask at Monks during Philly beer week. Im amazed this stuff has been available for so long, I have a feeling they have more than they let on. 

The waitress warned us that the beer was flat and tasted like vinegar; it seemed she really didnt even want us to buy it. Fool! The pour was a gorgeous deep red, with the slightest touch of carbonation and head. The aroma was intoxicating, deeply funky, sweaty, horsy, sour, like a dead cherry tree growing in a sauna converted from a horse shed. Mmmm. Just begging to be drank. There was a touch of thinness and lack of complexity in the flavor, however the sourness and funk was deep and very enjoyable. Easy drinking, thick yet still light in body. Top notch.

On cask at Monks. Noses with a very tart, dry cottony Morello cherry pits and skins. Pie-like. Tangy and lemon-juice inflected. Pours a vibrant, bold, bold crimson-blood with pale rose finger. Flavor is rich, with a punchy mix of gueze and fruit. The flavor of the cherries isnt so much dominant, as lifting the tart, skin-like dryness of the gueze to a different level. The cask presentation, I find, disconcerting, however. It really dampens the desirable profile of the style. I miss the prickly, bursting, carbonation of a well conditioned fruit beer, and instead find the softness of the cask presentation doesnt meld well with tart, citric quality of the beer. Ends with a lightly sweet cherry-filling quality. All that being said, its still pretty freaking delicious.
Draft at Monks: had this a while back and forgot to rate, very nice dark red with a white head, sour aroma and taste.  Good stuff.

Draft at Monks cafe.  Beautiful look; a rich, deep crimson with a whimsical fluffy snow-white head.  I took a few notable things away from this.  First, the lack of carbonation, which normally bothers me but actually created a nice, soft feel, probably due to the hand cask.  Next, there was a relatively low acidity level, allowing the fruit to shine in a well put-together, nuanced package.  Subtle and refreshing.  Not mind blowing though, Im kind of surprised at the recent high ratings for this one.

Cask at Monks.  Pours one of the deepest dark violet reds of any Kriek. Mostly still with just a slight carbonation, no head, but the acidity makes up for the low carb and stays somewhat lively on the tongue.  Aroma is of rediculously fresh cherry pulp, juice, and puree and low on the stone, almond and pitty character- light on the overall farmhouse funk as the cherry is dominant- has nice tart character in the nose though.  Flavor is fresh dark almost tart black cherries with lots of tannic skin and some hints of pit and cyanide.  Great sharp, yet not overpowering, lactic acidity which cuts through the big powerful cherry fruits.  Smooth as hell on the finish with a nice astringency, and good acidity.  So good, I had to buy another glass.
Deep red, hazy, nearly flat.  Aroma of sour cherries and dust.  Full mouth, fruits up front followed by sour driness.  Very nice.

Cask at Monks.  Pours a deep ruby red with a small bubbly lighter pink head.  Aroma of this great red wine, oaky nose with wonderfully tart cherry notes.  Also getting some wild yeast, various tropical fruits and vanilla.  Floral and the nose in this is just amazing.  Flavor of tart cherries, perfumey oak, wild yeast, vanilla, red wine, vineous.  Smooth, tart and lightly sour.  Thanks Monks!

Cask at Monks... Poured a lightly hazy ruby red color with no head or lacing.  Aroma of fresh sour cherries, vanilla oak, leather, and wild yeast.  Taste was amazingly fresh cherries, vanilla, wild yeast, lacto sourness, cherry pit, and a dry, oaky finish.  Served at the perfect temperature from Monks cellar, with an oily, smooth mouthfeel.  This was the best fruit lambic ive ever had.

Draught  Bright red, gorgeous ruby colour with one or two bubbles. Deep superfruit, cherries, very densely flavoured; fusel alcohols, vanilla. Peperkoek, sour cherries, not very sour, pure fruits. Still, I get some oily-like flavours from the cherrykernels. Super lip-smacking titillating fruitacids, and extremely refreshing. Super - Im repeating myself. Fruitlambic in the best way.

Opaque very dark pink. Headless, uncarbonated for the moment. Extremely fresh nose! Remarkably well extracted cherry flavours, no comparison with the regular bottled kriek that is all about extreme acidity. Quite phenolic this one still, almost clovey, a bit medicinal, bordering plasticy and spicy. Certainly juicy though, but a tannic one at that. Not quite soft, but certainly not rough, yet the finish hints at character to come. Still, in this shape, very good.

On tap @ Bruxellensis. Recolte (Harvest) 2007... The fresh stuff, just tapped the week before, they said. OK then. It was a deep, dark red with a few bubbles on top. Big, black cherry aroma with some wild cherry. Tart, slightly sweet, and raw: very fruity flavor, all cherry, managing only mild acidity, medium body, and a cherry-stem aftertaste. Refreshing and incredibly flavorful.
Tried at Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 27/05/06. Dull cherry red body with no head. Sour aged taste of cherry. Liked the Mort Subite Oude Kriek better.

Draught. The body is orange-brown with a small white head. Aroma is complex wood, pine, and citrus. Wonderfully dry earthy flavour with that oak appearing again. Very, very dry now that I think of it. I didnt get very much fruit in the flavour, not cherry at least, just grapefruit and then some oak on the lips. 

Sampled at the Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation on May 28, 2006.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2009 Draft pour
Consumed at the Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation, Opstal, May 2006 Dark red, mostly clear appearance with a still thin head.  Nose is slightly sour, almost muddy, bloody, lightly tinny.  However, the nose is quite strong and pungent.  Sourness is transparent up front, before exploding on the palate at the back of the tongue... good, strong acidity (like citrus acidity), punch-like, intensely sour and lightly musty, and the fruit shows up almost as a sweet raspberry flavor rather than cherry.

Draught  Clear deep red body; Very sour citrus, wooden nose some very nice cherry behind; Extremely sour body, with not much else then sourness; Into very sour finish only little cherry and some marzipan. Vinegar like in both nose and finish.

[Draft at GBBF 2005] An unclear pink beer with no head - a somewhat artificial look - eventhough I know Cantillon is as far away from artificial as anything can be. The aroma is sour with very strong notes of cherries combined with lesser notes of grapefruit. The flavor has a nice sourness that draws out the mouthwater and has nice notes of both cherries and grapefruit.

Draught at GBBF, August 2005. Ludicrously pink in colour. So pink it put me off a bit. Very fruity too. Soft and restrained for a Cantillon. Didnt really exhibit the trademark Cantillon farmyard and mouth-puckering tartness that Ive come to expect. Dont get me wrong, this is a very good beer, just doesnt shout out "Cantillon" loud enough for me. I prefer a touch more aggression.

Tasted directly from the cask at the brewery.
Hazy deep red colored with no head of course. Wonderful cherry nose with some sourness and a good complexity.
Full and sour cherry flavor with woody and grapefruity tones. Complex and balanced and tasty as hell.
Definately a must-have-again lambic.

Sweet cherries, rubber, barnyard, leather all play well off each other in the aroma.  Opaque bright red body with low pink head that is mostly diminishing, but what a colour!  Leafy wood, cherries, light, rubbery phenolics, and a low finishing acidity highlight the flavour.  Medium-light body with somewhat low carbonation.  Sampled on tap at GBBF 2005.

Barrel (GBBF): Cloudy glowing red with a pink short lasted head, otherwise flat. Bigg acidic nose, loads of sour cherries and funky cheese behind. Flavour is balanced sweet cherries and acidic tart sour stuff. Juicy, and great.

On tap at GBBF 05. As Mark says below, we established that this is what we all tried. Pink like a halluciantion, or a whoopee cushion. Opaque too, but no head or carbonation. Citric cherry flavour, tart, but not sour like oher Cantillons. Nice, sweet cherries on the finish. Lemony overall, in aroma also. This is quality.

Draught - gravity dispense -  GBBF 2005.  We were reliably informed by Jacob that the beer at GBBF described as Jonge Kriek was this kriekenlambiek.  Kook may be able to provide more technical evidence for this when he rates it as he was given information by the bar manager.  Anyway the beer was the pinkest thing Ive ever seen for a beer.  A real strawberryade colour.  The aroma featured subdued cherry fruit and not much typical lambic farmyardy stuff.  The taste is pretty much the same.  The acidity and sourness are pretty low.  A drinkable fruity beer.

From a wooden cask at the brewery. This was going to be Lou Pepe Kriek. Very red coloured. Very woody cherry aroma. Acidic and very fruity flavour. Very low carbonation. Tart and dry finish. Pure cherry juice. Extremely refreshing and tasty.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2005 Draught  No head off course.  Hazy red body.  Nose of cherries, cask wood, red wine.  Heavily acidic, lightly bitter initial flavour.  Heavily acidic finish.  Finish lasts averagily long.  Lightly bodied.  A very well-balanced flavour, not as flat as other lambics, but still some flatness.  And also not as aggressive as the blended kriek.  Heavenly!
